markdown:
<title level="1" pfs="">[Beast Tamer](/NPCs.aspx?ID=3576)</title>

<row gap="medium">

<column gap="medium" flex="1 1 400px">

Beast tamers bring the wild to civilization, rearing and training creatures to follow their commands and perform flashy tricks that entertain audiences. The beast tamer typically fights alongside a trained animal ally of its level or lower, most likely a [tiger](/Monsters.aspx?ID=2867).

<column gap="tiny">
**[Recall Knowledge - Humanoid](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**
([Society](/Skills.aspx?ID=47)): DC 19

**[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 17

**[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 14
</column>

</column>

<column gap="medium">

</column>

</row>

<title level="2" right="Creature 4">[Beast Tamer](/NPCs.aspx?ID=3576)</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Medium" />
<trait label="Human" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=627" />
<trait label="Humanoid" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=628" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [NPC Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=236) pg. 128

**Perception** +12

**Languages**
[Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1), [Wildsong](/Languages.aspx?ID=116)

**Skills**
[Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=36) +8, [Circus Lore](/Skills.aspx?ID=41) +6, [Diplomacy](/Skills.aspx?ID=39) +8, [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=40) +8, [Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=43) +12, [Performance](/Skills.aspx?ID=45) +8, [Survival](/Skills.aspx?ID=49) +10

<row gap="medium">
**Str** +2

**Dex** +1

**Con** +2

**Int** +0

**Wis** +4

**Cha** +2
</row>

**Wild Empathy** The beast tamer can use [Diplomacy](/Skills.aspx?ID=39) to [Make an Impression](/Actions.aspx?ID=2392) on [animals](/Traits.aspx?ID=531) and to make very simple [Requests](/Actions.aspx?ID=2393) of them.

**Items**
animal claw necklace ([primal symbol](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2743)), [Leather Armor](/Armor.aspx?ID=4), [Rope](/Equipment.aspx?ID=44) (50 feet), [Whip](/Weapons.aspx?ID=48)

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="medium">
**AC** 20 

**Fort** +10 

**Ref** +7 

**Will** +12 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**HP** 55

</row>

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

**Speed** 25 feet

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
fist +12 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Nonlethal](/Traits.aspx?ID=188), [Unarmed](/Traits.aspx?ID=199)),
**Damage** 1d4+6 bludgeoning

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
whip +12 ([Disarm](/Traits.aspx?ID=175), [Nonlethal](/Traits.aspx?ID=188), [Reach](/Traits.aspx?ID=192), [Trip](/Traits.aspx?ID=196)),
**Damage** 1d4+6 slashing

**Primal Prepared Spells** DC 22, attack +13
- **Cantrips (2nd)**
[Light](/Spells.aspx?ID=171), [Guidance](/Spells.aspx?ID=142), [Ignition](/Spells.aspx?ID=1565), [Stabilize](/Spells.aspx?ID=307), [Tangle Vine](/Spells.aspx?ID=1713)
- **1st**
[Grease](/Spells.aspx?ID=140), [Jump](/Spells.aspx?ID=167), [Runic Body](/Spells.aspx?ID=1657)
- **2nd**
[Animal Form](/Spells.aspx?ID=10), [Animal Messenger](/Spells.aspx?ID=11), [Speak with Animals](/Spells.aspx?ID=293)

**Druid Order Spells 1 Focus Point,** DC 22
- **1st**
[Heal Animal](/Spells.aspx?ID=474)

**Animal Trick** <actions string="Single Action" />  The beast tamer gains the support benefit appropriate to its trainedanimal companion. Unlike for an animal companion, this doesn't require the animal to use any of its actions. The benefit for a tiger is as follows: Until the start of the beast tamer's next turn, their Strikes that deal damage to a creature within the tiger's reach make the target [off-guard](/Conditions.aspx?ID=58) until the end of the beast tamer's next turn.

</column>

<aside>
<title level="2" noclass="true" icon="/images/Icons/Sidebar_2_AdditionalLore.png">Ethical Taming</title>

Throughout the history of Golarion many entertainers thought very little about the conditions of the animals they kept. However, this is very rarely the case today. In fact, it is not uncommon that show animals are treated better than some of the performers. They are trained with positive reinforcement learning, and once safety can be assured, they live outside of a cage with the trainer themselves.
</aside>

<document level="2" id="creature-family-546" />
name: Beast Tamer
